div2.head: Output
div2.p: You can set a name for the output file(s); if you ask for multiple output files, this name will be used to create unique filenames for each section. By default, results will go to wherever your XSLT processor normally writes (usually standard output). If you opt to have files created, you can specify the name of the directory where the output is to be placed.
If you are making HTML, do you want a single output page, or a separate one for each section of the document? You can decide to have a different splitting policy for front and back matter.

glossList.item: (string) The complete URL when the document is being delivered from a web server (normally set by Apache or Cocoon)
(boolean) Write to standard output channel true
(string) An ID passed to the stylesheet to indicate which section to display
(string) A path fragment to put before all internal URLs
(string) The name of the input file
(string) Directory in which to place generated files.
(string) Encoding of output file(s). iso-8859-1
(string) Output method for output file(s). html
(string) Public Doctype of output file(s). -//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0 Transitional//EN
(string) System Doctype of output file(s). http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd
(string) The style of HTML (Simple, CSS or Table) which creates the layout for generated pages. Simple
(boolean) Pass through input essentially unchanged false
(boolean) Break back matter into separate HTML pages (if splitting enabled). true
(boolean) Break front matter into separate HTML pages (if splitting enabled). true
(integer) Level at which to split sections. -1

(string) Suffix for generated output files.
.xml .html
.html
(boolean) Display navigation panel at top of pages. true
(string) How to specify infra-document links. When a document is split, links need to be constructed between parts of the document. The default is to use a query parameter on the URL. ?ID=
(boolean) Construct links using existing ID values. true
(string) Language (for hyphenation) en_US
(string) Name of intended XSL FO engine
(string) URL root where referenced documents are located http://www.tei-c.org
(boolean) Whether or not to load LaTeX packages which attempt to process the UTF-8 characters. Set to "false" if you are using XeTeX or similar. true
(boolean) Use real name of graphics files rather than pointers true

div2.head: Layout
div2.p: There are three ways to provide a constant navigation aid. You can either make the whole page into a table, where the first column has a table of contents, or you can make an HTML frameset, or you can just have a table of links on the left or right

Hypertext links present special problems, as we have to choose whether they should start a new window, occupy all of the current window, or stay within the frame. These stylesheets implement the following rules:
Any ref or ptr link stays within the frame
Any link containing :// uses the whole browser window
Any link starting . uses the whole browser window
If the stylesheet sets no splitting of the document, any xref or xptr link uses the whole browser window
If a xref or xptr link has a rend attribute value of noframe, the whole browser window is used
If a xref or xptr link has a rend attribute value of new, a new browser window is started

div2.head: Standard page features
div2.p: The default behaviour of the system is to construct each HTML page with per-page navigation bars top and bottom, and a standard set of navigation links underneath.

glossList.item: (string) Name of department within institution
(string) Name of link to home page of application Home
(anyURI) Home URL of project http://www.tei-c.org/
(string) Label for link to project TEI
(string) Name of institution TEI XSL Stylesheets
(anyURI) Link to overall institution http://www.tei-c.org/
(string) Name of overall institution My Parent Institution
(anyURI) Link to search application http://www.google.com
(string) How to align the navigation panel at the bottom of the page right
(boolean) Display navigation panel at bottom of pages true
(anyURI) Link for feedback mailto:feedback
(string) Fixed string to insert before normal page title in HTML meta <title> element
(boolean) Make a panel with next page/previous page links. true

div2.head: Headings
div2.p: Headings for sections can be customized in various ways.

glossList.item: (boolean) Construct a heading (eg "Heading") for <div> elements with no <head>

(string) Punctuation to insert after a section number
.
(string) Character to put after number of section header

How to make a heading for section if there is no <head>
Heading

div2.head: Numbering
div2.p: Section headings, figures, tables and notes can be numbered automatically. We can set the numbering of front matter and back matter separately. If you prefer to supply your own numbering, using the n attribute, you can choose this over automatic numbering.
Normally, heading numbers are followed by . , but you can vary this. This would let you use eg fixed spaces.

glossList.item: (boolean) Automatically number figures in back matter false
(string) How to construct heading numbering in back matter A.1
(boolean) Automatically number tables in back matter true
(string) How to construct heading numbering in main matter 1.1.1.1
(boolean) Automatically number figures true
(boolean) Automatically number figures in front matter false
(string) How to construct heading numbering in front matter
(boolean) Automatically number tables in front matter true
(boolean) Automatically number sections true
(integer) Depth to which sections should be numbered 9
(boolean) Automatically number tables true
(boolean) Use value of "n" attribute to number sections false
(boolean) Automatically number paragraphs. false
How to number sections in back matter
How to number sections in main matter
How to number sections in front matter

div2.head: Table of contents generation
div2.p: You probably want tables of contents built for your document, using the div structure. However, if you have used a divGen type="toc" explicitly, that will also create a table of contents, so you can suppress the automatic one. When a table of contents is created, you choose how many levels of headings it will show. You can choose whether or not the front and backmatter appear in the table of contents.

glossList.item: (boolean) Make an automatic table of contents true
(string) CSS class for second-level TOC entries subtoc
(integer) Depth at which to stop doing a recursive table of contents. -1
(boolean) Include the back matter in the table of contents. true
(string) Depth to which table of contents is constructed. 5
(boolean) Include the front matter in the table of contents. true
(string) Indentation for level 0 TOC entries 0in
(string) Indentation for level 1 TOC entries 0.25in
(string) Indentation for level 2 TOC entries 0.5in
(string) Indentation for level 3 TOC entries 0.75in
(string) Indentation for level 4 TOC entries 1in
(boolean) Make TOC for sections in <back> true
(boolean) Make TOC for sections in <front> true
(string) Punctuation to insert after a section number in a TOC .
(integer) Page number on which TOC should start 1

div2.head: Internationalization
div2.p: At various places, the system has to create text. You can choose the words it uses (eg translate them to another language).

glossList.item: Make a copyright claim This page is copyrighted

div2.head: CSS
div2.p: Setting up material for the CSS file to accompany HTML output.

glossList.item: (string) CSS class for TOC entries toc

(string) Default alignment of tables left
(string) Default colour for background of table cells which are labelling rows or columns silver
(boolean) Force tables to appear inline false
(boolean) Put a caption on tables true
(string) Alignment of table captions center
(string) Default padding on table cells 2pt

always

div2.head: Figures and graphics
div2.p: Sometimes you need to prefix the names of all graphics files with a directory name or a URL, or provide a default suffix. You can also tell figure elements whether or not to produce anything.

glossList.item: (string) Directory specification to put before names of graphics files, unless they start with "./"
(string) Default file suffix for graphics files, if not directly specified .png
(decimal) Scaling of imported graphics 1
(integer) Resolution of images. This is needed to calculate HTML width and height (in pixels) from supplied dimensions. 96
(boolean) Display figures. true
(string) How to scale figures if no width and height specified (pass to XSL FO content-width)
(boolean) Put captions on inline figures false
(boolean) Show the contents of <head> in a cross-reference to table or figure false
(boolean) Show a title for figures or tables (eg Table or Figure) in a cross-reference false
(boolean) Show the page number in a cross-reference to table or figure false
Set attributes for display of figures center italic

div2.head: Style
div2.p:
You can choose lots of features which affect the font, size, etc
What font to use for URLs.
Whether titles, dates and authors are shown.
Whether headings of objects are included in cross-references.

div2.head: Hooks
div2.p: A set of templates which are empty by default; they can be used to add code at strategic points. The content must be valid XSLT.

glossList.item: Hook where HTML can be inserted just after <body>
Hook where Javascript calls can be inserted just after <body>
Hook where extra CSS can be inserted
Hook where code can be added to the HTML <head>.
Hook where HTML can be inserted when creating an
Hook where extra Javascript functions can be defined
Hook where HTML can be inserted just before the <address>
Hook where HTML can be inserted at the start of processing each section
Hook where HTML can be inserted at the beginning of the main text, after the header
Hook where HTML can be inserted after processing <TEI>
Hook where HTML can be inserted before processing <TEI>
Hook where HTML can be inserted when creating an <a> element
Hook where extra material can be inserted after the <body> has been processed
Hook where work can be done at the start of each block
Hook where extra page masters can be defined
Hook where LaTeX commands can be inserted after \begin{document}
Hook where LaTeX commands can be inserted in the preamble before \begin{document}

div2.head: Miscellaneous and advanced
div2.p: Finally, some miscellaneous or advanced features which you probably won't use much.

(boolean) Generate a unique ID for all paragraphs true

(boolean) Show a title and author at start of document false
(boolean) Be talkative while working. false
